New Records: The White Sox tied the 1916 Philadelphia Athletics for the third most losses since 1900 with 117 losses.
Andrew Vaughn led off the fourth inning with his team-tying 19th home run.
Key Match Events: Eric Wagaman scored with one out in the 13th inning when Jordyn Adams' grounder deflected off the glove of third baseman Miguel Vargas.
The game went into extra innings tied at one.
Each team scored in the 10th as Chicago's Korey Lee scored on Vargas' sacrifice fly and Los Angeles' Gustavo Campero had an RBI base hit.
Pre-Game Insights: The White Sox have a tough schedule ahead, including a three-game series at San Diego and a six-game homestand against the Angels and Detroit Tigers.
Post-Match Reflections: Angels manager Ron Washington said, "We had opportunities throughout the game to do something, we just couldnâ€™t stretch that run, especially in extra innings. But we kept going and finally caught a break."
Miscellaneous Highlights: The White Sox need to go 7-2 in their final nine games to avoid the post-1900 record of 120 losses by the 1962 expansion New York Mets.
The Angels had the bases loaded in the 10th and 12th innings, but were finally able to walk it off in the 13th.
Others: Mickey Moniak (left hand) did not start for the third straight day, but came in as a pinch runner in the 11th inning.
The Angels head to Houston for a four-game weekend series.
LHP Garrett Crochet (6-12, 3.78 ERA) takes the mound on Friday to start a three-game series at San Diego.
